content.question: Object <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> of mass <math alttext="m equals 1.0 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math> initially moves with a speed <math alttext="v equals 15 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> to the right towards Object <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> of mass <math alttext="m equals 2.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math>, which is initially at rest. After the collision, Object <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> rebounds with a speed <math alttext="v equals 5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> to the left and Object <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> moves with a speed <math alttext="v equals 10 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> to the right. Which of the following correctly indicates if the collision is elastic, and justifies this response?

choices.label: The collision is elastic because the momentum of the two-object system before the collision is equal to the momentum of the system after the collision.
The collision is elastic because the kinetic energy of the two-object system before the collision is equal to the kinetic energy of the system after the collision.
The collision is not elastic because the momentum of the two-object system before the collision is not equal to the momentum of the system after the collision.
The collision is not elastic because the kinetic energy of the two-object system before the collision is not equal to the kinetic energy of the system after the collision.

content.answer: The collision is elastic because the kinetic energy of the two-object system before the collision is equal to the kinetic energy of the system after the collision.
